meanings.definition: Treat (rubber) with sulfur to improve its strength and elasticity.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers volcanize the rubber to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: It is important to volcanize the rubber before using it in manufacturing.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber band go to school? To learn how to volcanize!
meanings.sent4: Her determination volcanized her resolve to succeed in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The image of the erupting volcano helped him understand how sulfur can volcanize rubber.

meanings.definition: Subject (rubber) to a process of vulcanization.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully volcanizes the rubber to ensure quality.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers volcanize rubber to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: The rubber tire chuckled as it was about to be volcanized.
meanings.sent4: The idea of change can volcanize a stagnant situation into something new and improved.
meanings.sent5: The smell of sulfur filled the room as they began to volcanize the rubber, transforming it into a useful material.

meanings.sent1: The rubber bands volcanize easily when exposed to heat.
meanings.sent2: Rubber volcanizes during the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck was surprised to volcanize in the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to volcanize with joy as he witnessed the successful vulcanization process.
meanings.sent5: The concept of change can volcanize a person's perspective, making them see things in a new light.
